transcript_excerpt.text: So I just uh sent some messages to some friends and now we can I sent some messages to some friends about this project.
And the next thing that I'm going to do is update the processing logic so that the message it stays up the whole time while I'm recording a video.
Because right now what happens is um there's a message from the most recent response from the assistant.
And when I press record, it goes away and says processing for a few seconds.
But then before I'm done recording, the message pops back up, and that's distracting because it seems like the assistant has responded to me, but really what happened is something else.

transcript_excerpt.text: Okay, we made a thing. It's working. I just recently said that I wanted the assistant window to stay static while I'm recording a video. So that is what happened. And now I want to move on to uh the list of videos on the right.

It is not seems not necessary to have something like that where I'm getting a list of videos. The whole point of this app is to just pay attention to like one focal point. And so having all the information about all the videos that I just recorded is not um helpful necessarily. Uh so I guess
I would like it removed because it doesn't serve a purpose.

summary: This video features a man with a beard lying down and talking to the camera. He discusses the state of an agent interface and his expectations for its development. He also talks about recording videos and having an assistant use cumulative memory information to inform his statements.
actions: The man is lying down. He initially touches his hair and then puts his arms behind his head. He speaks directly to the camera and makes occasional hand gestures.

transcript_excerpt.text: So the state of the agent interface is not becoming compelling over time like I hoped it would.

I am reading what the assistant has to say after every time I record the video and it's just a simple observation about the video I recorded and what I want to have happen is for the assistant to use the cumulative effect of the memory information that we are recording to inform what it says to me.
